thread.title: Saturday's prep roundup: Pack mentality vaults STC East boys XC atop River
thread.title_full: Saturday's prep roundup: Pack mentality vaults STC East boys XC atop River

title: Saturday's prep roundup: Pack mentality vaults STC East boys XC atop River
text:
Saturday's prep roundup: Pack mentality vaults STC East boys XC atop River Published: Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015 4:38 p.m. CDT 
BARTLETT – The St. Charles East boys cross country team may not have boasted the leader of the pack at Saturday's Upstate Eight Conference River Division meet, but the Saints' penchant for packing up earned something better. 
A team title. 
Michael Gerkin (15:30.1), Mark Sciurba (15:30.2) and Jack Rzepecki (15:32.1) finished second through fourth for the Saints, who had 27 points at Sunrise Park, 14 better than runner-up Geneva. Fellow senior Brett Izzo (15:43.6) was sixth for East. 
"We had four up there pretty much the whole way, for 2 1/2 miles, at least," Saints coach Chris Bosworth said. "We've had a pretty good pack pretty much all year." 
This particular triumph was all the sweeter given East's familiarity – or lack thereof – with the host venue. 
"To be honest, the last time I was there was maybe my first year at St. Charles (2009)," Bosworth said. "It had been a long time. I know the course, but none of my kids, the seniors, had run on that course. This was their first time." 
Geneva junior Tyler Dau won the race in 15:26.5. 
Shea Bastian (fifth, 15:33.3) paced Batavia to a third-place team finish. Jose Rangel (14th, 15:58.2) earned top honors for St. Charles North, which took fourth in the seven-team field. 
Northern Illinois Big 12 meet: At Afton Forest Preserve in DeKalb, Matt Richtman (second, 15:29.3) and Austin Kintz (seventh, 15:54.1) earned individual top 10 finishes to boost Kaneland to a runner-up team effort. The Knights had 69 points. Yorkville was champion with 87. 
Big Northern Conference meet: At Burlington, host Burlington Central finished sixth among 14 teams with a score of 141. Rockford Christian (77) was champion. Jack Hartmann took second individually for the Rockets, finishing in 15:56.60. 
GIRLS CROSS COUNTRY 
Upstate Eight Conference River Division meet: At Sunrise Park in Bartlett, Batavia (35 points) edged Geneva (40) for the title behind a trio of top 10 finishes. Emma Stephens was second in 17:32.6, while Dakota Roman (fourth, 18:02.1) and Daphne Kolody (eighth, 18:21.3) followed. 
McKenzie Altmayer of Geneva was the individual champion in 17:19.8, while teammate Emma Ehrhardt placed fifth in 18:09. 
Audrey Ernst (third, 17:47.8) paced North. Anastasia Honea was East' top runner, taking sixth in 18:13.5. 
Northern Illinois Big 12 meet: At Afton Forest Preserve in DeKalb, Kaneland's Brianna Bower earned the individual title in 18:01.9, five seconds clear of her nearest competitor. The Knights were second among 10 teams with 68 points, trailing only champion Yorkville (27). 
Noelle Espino was seventh for Kaneland in 18:51.7. 
Big Northern Conference meet: At Burlington, Burlington Central's Megan Safranski was second individually in 18:09.60, two seconds behind champion Breanne Retherford of Richmond-Burton. The Rockets were eighth among 15 teams with a 203. Dixon (56) won the title. 
GIRLS TENNIS 
Waubonsie Valley Sectional: At Aurora, Rosary won the sectional with 18 points, edging co- runners-up West Aurora and Oswego East, who scored 16 apiece. 
Freshman Maria Goheen won the singles title to advance to the state tournament, which begins Thursday at various District 211, 214 and 220 courts. The Aurora Christian doubles tandem of freshmen Shelby Johnson and Madie Jurasek won in doubles play and also is state-bound. Johnson is from Geneva, while Jurasek hails from Sugar Grove. 
GIRLS VOLLEYBALL 
Lincoln-Way Central Invitational: At New Lenox, Burlington Central went 3-2 in tournament play and now stands at 28-5.
